data.text: now that I'm thinking about it I can't remember if mine came with the cover or if I purchased it separately. I got it in 2016. They do sell the Brooks branded cover on Amazon for like 12 bucks though and I've never had a problem using that one. You can even Ride with It on without it bunching up. It's been 6 years and I haven't had to replace it.
data.author: John Alan Steigenberger

data.text:
Not sure where in the world you are, but this is what I use, and it works great! Plus it rolls up and tucks away under the seat no problem, so I always have it if I'm commuting, etc. It's also nice if I have to lock my bike to grab groceries or something - it makes the saddle look less nice than it is. https://www.mec.ca/en/product/5040-327/Waterproof-Saddle-Cover

data.text: the Brooks brand cover cinches all the way around the seat post
data.author: John Alan Steigenberger

data.text: I don't let mine sit outside in the rain. It prolonged soaking that damages it. Keep it well greased up with Proofide and it'll be fine for most rain showers. I've ridden 20 miles in heavy rain with mine with only my butt covering the saddle ... wip it off at the end of the ride, dry it indoors and put another coating of Proofide under and on top. I do cover mine if it's going to rain while I'm traveling with the bike, or just take it off and put it inside the car. I have a Brooks cover, but hardly ever use it.
data.author: Richard Welch
